snippet: Officials had hoped for an agreement before both Presidents Obama and Castro attend the Summit of the Americas in April.
abstract: United States and Cuba end third round of talks regarding re-establishment of diplomatic relations with no breakthrough on areas of contention; talks have been taking place amid atmosphere of rising tension over Venezuela, and Cuban news media has been focused on Pres Raul Castro's visit to Venezuela, part of effort to show solidarity with Pres Nicolas Maduro.
lead_paragraph: Officials had hoped for an agreement before both Presidents Obama and Castro attend the Summit of the Americas in April.

headline.main: U.S.-Cuba Talks on Restoring Diplomatic Ties End Abruptly
headline.print_headline: Latest Talks on U.S.-Cuba Diplomatic Ties End
